results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the numerator of R(n,k) defined implicitly by the identity Sum_{i=0..l-1} Sum_{j=0..m} R(m,j)*(l-i)^j*i^j = l^(2*m+1) holding for all l,m >= 0.

formula: Recurrence given by _Max Alekseyev_ (see the MathOverflow link):
R(n, k) = 0 if k < 0 or k > n.
R(n, k) = (2k+1)*binomial(2k, k) if k = n.
R(n, k) = (2k+1)*binomial(2k, k)*Sum_{j=2k+1..n} R(n, j)*binomial(j, 2k+1)*(-1)^(j-1)/(j-k)*Bernoulli(2j-2k), otherwise.
maple: R := proc(n, k) if k < 0 or k > n then return 0 fi; (2*k+1)*binomial(2*k, k);
if n = k then % else -%*add((-1)^j*R(n, j)*binomial(j, 2*k+1)*
bernoulli(2*j-2*k)/(j-k), j=2*k+1..n) fi end: T := (n, k) -> numer(R(n, k)):
# Numerical check that S(m, n) = n^(2*m+1):
seq(seq(S(m, n) - n^(2*m+1), n=0..12), m=0..12); # _Peter Luschny_, Apr 30 2018
mathematica: BernoulliB[2 j - 2 k], {j, 2 k + 1, n}] /; 2 k + 1 <= n
R[n_, k_] := (2 n + 1)*Binomial[2 n, n] /; k == n;

program: (PARI) T(n, k) = if ((n>k) || (n<0), 0, if (k==n, (2*n+1)*binomial(2*n, n), if (2*n+1>k, 0, if (n==0, 1, (2*n+1)*binomial(2*n, n)*sum(j=2*n+1, k+1, T(j, k)*binomial(j, 2*n+1)*(-1)^(j-1)/(j-n)*bernfrac(2*j-2*n))))));
tabl(nn) = for (n=0, nn, for (k=0, n, print1(numerator(T(k,n)), ", ")); print); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 27 2018
